types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: CustomerQueryOutput
types.description: The result of a query for a customer or customers.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The resulting customer if the operation was successful.

fields.name: customers
fields.description: The resulting customers if the operation was successful and multiple results were returned.

fields.name: pageSize
fields.description: The size of the paginated results.

fields.name: lastEvaluatedKey
fields.description: This key can be used to continue querying paginated results.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Any validation errors encountered while running the mutation.

fields.name: success
fields.description: A simple boolean indicating whether or not the operation was successful.

types.name: Customer
types.description: A customer of Riverpoint Medical.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for this customer

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email of the customer.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the customer.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number of the customer.

fields.name: street
fields.description: The street address for the customer.

fields.name: street2
fields.description: The street address (line 2) for the customer.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city of the address for the customer.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the address for the customer.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip of the address for the customer.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country of the address for the customer.

fields.name: specialty
fields.description: The specialty of the customer.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ValidationError
types.description: A validation error that provides details for an unsuccesful mutation or query.

fields.name: path
fields.description: A path indicating the attribute that failed validation.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A brief description of why the specified attribute failed validation.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Product
types.description: A registered user object from API. Could be a customer, admin, or partner account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for this product

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this product.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A brief description of this product.

fields.name: modelNumbers
fields.description: All available variations or configurations of this product.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The model number identifying a product variant.

fields.name: pricing
fields.description: Pricing for this specific model.

fields.name: productIds
fields.description: The ids of the product(s) this variant can be associated with.

fields.name: products
fields.description: The product(s) this variant can be associated with.

fields.name: productType
fields.description: The high level category for this model number.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A brief description of this product variant.

fields.name: lotted
fields.description: If a product is lotted it has a class of serial numbers associated to it.

fields.name: warrantyTerm
fields.description: The length of the warranty that applies to this model in months.

fields.name: warrantyDescription
fields.description: A description of the warranty that applies to this model.

fields.name: resolutionWithWarranty
fields.description: How issues will be resolved if this item is covered by a warranty.

fields.name: resolutionWithoutWarranty
fields.description: How issues will be resolved if this item is not covered by a warranty.

fields.name: feeWithWarranty
fields.description: How much will it cost to service this item if it is covered by a warranty.

fields.name: feeWithoutWarranty
fields.description: How much will it cost to service this item if it is not covered by a warranty.

fields.name: publicNotes
fields.description: Any public notes related to servicing this model variation.

fields.name: privateNotes
fields.description: Any internal notes for employess when servicing this model variation.

fields.name: publiclyViewable
fields.description: If a product model is not publicly viewableit will not show up on forms for a customer.

fields.name: symptoms
fields.description: A list of all associated symptoms related to this model number.

types.name: Pricing
types.description: Pricing for a product model variant.

fields.name: cost
fields.description: Internal cost pricing for distributors.

fields.name: retail
fields.description: Public pricing for end users.

types.name: ProductType
types.description: Denotes the high level category for this product.

enumValues.name: HEADLIGHT
enumValues.description: A dedicated family of headlight.

enumValues.name: ACCESSORY
enumValues.description: An accessory to a headlight.

types.name: FeeStructure
types.description: Pricing for fees associated to a repair.

fields.name: distributor
fields.description: Internal cost pricing for distributors.

fields.name: endUser
fields.description: Public pricing for end users.

types.name: ProductSymptom
types.description: A troubleshooting symptom for a product.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for this symptom

fields.name: name
fields.description: The actual name of the symptom.

fields.name: careTip
fields.description: A hint or maintenance tip to prevent the symptom.

fields.name: synopsis
fields.description: A description of the symptom and/or it's cause in detail.

fields.name: solution
fields.description: A solution to resolve the symptom.

fields.name: fee
fields.description: Indicates if there is an associated fee for servicing this issue.

fields.name: preApproved
fields.description: Indicates whether or not this is a pre-approved repair regardless of warranty.

fields.name: faultCode
fields.description: An official code used to identify this symptom.

fields.name: associatedModelNumbers
fields.description: A list of all associated model numbers related to this symptom.

fields.name: modelNumbers
fields.description: The resulting symptoms if the operation was successful and multiple results were returned.

fields.name: attachedImages
fields.description: An array of attached images hosted via AWS S3.

types.name: ModelNumberSymptomDetail
types.description: A subset of the model number type

fields.name: id
fields.description: The model number identifying a product variant.

fields.name: productId
fields.description: The id of the product this variant belongs to.

fields.name: symptoms
fields.description: All associated symptoms related to this model number.

types.name: AttachedImage
types.description: An image that can be associated to any another type.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID or Key on AWS S3 representing the image.

fields.name: url
fields.description: A pre-signed url to fetch this image from S3.

fields.name: position
fields.description: The user defined sort priority for the attached image.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current upload status of the image regarding its availability on S3.

types.name: UploadStatus
types.description: Indicates whether or not an image is currently transferring, available, or even deleted.

types.name: User
types.description: A registered user object from API. Could be a customer, admin, or partner account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for this user

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address for this user.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The actual first name of the user.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The actual last name of the user.

types.name: RGAStatus
types.description: Defines a state a given RGA could be in.

enumValues.name: ISSUED
enumValues.description:
An RGA number has been issued to the distributor but the customer
has not completed or shipped the package.

enumValues.name: AWAITING_ARRIVAL
enumValues.description:
The customer has confirmed the goods associated to the request and
RPMED is awaiting the delivery of the customer's package.

enumValues.name: ASSESSING
enumValues.description: RPMED team is assessing the contents of the package.

enumValues.name: REPAIRING
enumValues.description: RPMED team is making any necessary repairs.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING
enumValues.description: RPMED team has shipped the package back to the customer.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The request is complete and no further notes / changes can be made.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description:
The request was canceled at any point during the process. Notes may
may be added for further explanation.

enumValues.name: DELAYED
enumValues.description:
Indicates the RGA may have partially shipped but still has some pending
items that have been delayed.

types.name: RGAQueryOutput
types.description: The result of a query for a RGA or RGAs.

fields.name: rga
fields.description: The resulting RGA if the operation was successful.

fields.name: rgas
fields.description: The resulting RGAs if the operation was successful and multiple results were returned.

fields.name: pageSize

fields.name: lastEvaluatedKey

fields.description: Any validation errors encountered while running the mutation.

fields.description: A simple boolean indicating whether or not the operation was successful.

types.name: RGA
types.description: A Request Goods Authorization.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for this RGA.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current state of the request.

fields.name: submittedOn
fields.description: The date the RGA was submitted.

fields.name: submittedBy
fields.description: The email address of the user whom submitted the RGA.

fields.name: distributor
fields.description: The distributor associated to the the RGA.

fields.name: goods
fields.description: The goods associated to the the RGA.

fields.name: statusLog
fields.description: A log of all updates to this RGAs status.

fields.name: shippingSpeed
fields.description: The preferred shipping speed assigned to return this request to the customer.

types.name: RGAGood
types.description: A good associated to a particular RGA.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique serial number or uuid associated to the good.

fields.name: rgaId
fields.description: The RGA this good is assigned to.

fields.name: modelNumber
fields.description: The model number for representing the specific product configuration for this good.

fields.name: lotted
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the model was considered to be lotted.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the good.

fields.name: warrantied
fields.description: Indicates whether or not this product is currently under warranty.

fields.name: ssd
fields.description: Indicates whether or not an SSD is applicable to this good.

fields.name: warrantyDescription
fields.description: Indicates the details of the associated products warranty.

fields.name: warrantyTerm
fields.description: Indicates the number of months the associated product was warrantied for.

fields.name: symptomId
fields.description: The symptom / reason this product is being returned.

fields.name: symptomDescription
fields.description: The current description of the symptom.

fields.name: preApproved
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the resolution for the symptom was a pre-approved repair.

fields.name: faultCode
fields.description: The fault code associated to the prescribed symptom.

fields.name: serial
fields.description: The serial number unique to this good if lotted. If left blank and not lotted a uuid will be generated.

fields.name: productType
fields.description: Indicates the product type for this good.

fields.name: productName
fields.description: Indicates the name of product family this good.

fields.name: productId
fields.description: Indicates the product family this good.

fields.name: resolution
fields.description: The proposed resolution the issue affecting this good.

fields.name: symptomSynopsis
fields.description: The synopsis of the associated symptom.

fields.name: symptomSolution
fields.description: The solution for associated symptom.

fields.name: resolutionFee
fields.description: The fee involved for resolving this issue.

fields.name: rma
fields.description: The associated RMA from our distributor / partner's records.

fields.name: po
fields.description: The associated PO from our distributor / partner's records.

fields.name: customerLetterUrl
fields.description: A URL to download a generated PDF of the associated customerletter.

fields.name: serviceFormUrl
fields.description: A URL to download a generated PDF of the associated service form.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Any additional notes about this good specifically..

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: The id of the customer if the product has been registered to a user.

fields.name: customerName
fields.description: The name of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

fields.name: customerEmail
fields.description: The email of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

fields.name: customerPhone
fields.description: The phone number of the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerStreet
fields.description: The street address for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerStreet2
fields.description: The street address (line 2) for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerCity
fields.description: The city of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerState
fields.description: The state of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerZip
fields.description: The zip of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerCountry
fields.description: The country of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

fields.name: customerSpecialty
fields.description: The specialty of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

fields.name: shippingSpeed
fields.description: The preferred shipping speed assigned to return this good to the customer.

fields.name: tracking
fields.description: The tracking number associated to the return shipment.

fields.name: carrier
fields.description: The carrier used to transport the return shipment.

fields.name: datePurchased
fields.description: The original date of purchase if known.

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: The disposition of the good after evaluation.

fields.name: additionalComments
fields.description: Any additional comments for the service letter.

types.name: RGAGoodStatus
types.description: The current status of a given good belonging to an RGA.

enumValues.name: VALID
enumValues.description: The good is considered valid and part of the request.

enumValues.name: ARCHIVED
enumValues.description: The good was removed from the request at some point.

enumValues.name: DELAYED
enumValues.description: Indicates a good has been delayed from shipping.

types.name: RGAShippingCarrier
types.description: Indicates the shipping carrier used to transport a good associated to an RGA.

enumValues.name: FEDEX
enumValues.description: FedEx as a shipping carrier.

enumValues.name: UPS
enumValues.description: UPS as a shipping carrier.

enumValues.name: DHL
enumValues.description: DHL as a shipping carrier.

enumValues.name: OTHER
enumValues.description: Another shipping carrier not fully supported by the system.

types.name: RGAStatusUpdate
types.description: A description of a status update for a given RGA.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The new status the request was assigned.

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Any notes describing what happened to the request during this update.

fields.name: updatedBy
fields.description: Details about who made this update.

fields.name: updatedOn
fields.description: An ISO string representing when this update occurred.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the user who made the update.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the user who made the update.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address of the user who made the update.

types.name: RGAStatusCountOutput
types.description: A list of totals for any given rga status.

fields.name: issued
fields.description: Count of all issued RGAs that may not have been shipped.

fields.name: delayed
fields.description: Count of all RGAs that have delayed items.

fields.name: awaitingArrival
fields.description: Count of all RGAs awaiting arrival.

fields.name: received
fields.description: Count of all received RGAs that have not yet been assessed.

fields.name: assessing
fields.description: Count of all RGAs currently being assessed.

fields.name: repairing
fields.description: Count of all RGAs currently being repaired.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: Count of all RGAs being shipped back to customers.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Count of all closed RGAs.

fields.name: canceled
fields.description: Count of all canceled RGAs.

fields.name: success
fields.description: A simple boolean indicating whether or not the operation was successful.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Any validation errors encountered while running the mutation.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The root mutation for the schema.

fields.name: createCustomer
fields.description: Creates a new customer.

fields.name: updateCustomer
fields.description: Updates an existing customer.

fields.name: destroyCustomer
fields.description: Removes an existing customer.

fields.name: createDistributor
fields.description: Creates a new distributor.

fields.name: updateDistributor
fields.description: Updates an existing distributor.

fields.name: destroyDistributor
fields.description: Removes an existing distributor.

fields.name: createProduct
fields.description: Adds a new product.

fields.name: updateProduct
fields.description: Updates an existing product.

fields.name: destroyProduct
fields.description: Removes an existing product.

fields.name: createModelNumber
fields.description: Adds a new product variant.

fields.name: updateModelNumber
fields.description: Updates an existing product variant.

fields.name: updateModelNumberLotted
fields.description: Updates an existing product variant's lotted status.

fields.name: updateModelNumberViewable
fields.description: Updates an existing product variant's lotted status.

fields.name: destroyModelNumber
fields.description: Removes an existing product variant.

fields.name: createProductRegistration
fields.description: Creates a new registration.

fields.name: updateProductRegistration
fields.description: Updates an existing registration.

fields.name: destroyProductRegistration
fields.description: Removes an existing registration.

fields.name: createProductSymptom
fields.description: Creates a new symptom.

fields.name: updateProductSymptom
fields.description: Updates an existing symptom.

fields.name: destroyProductSymptom
fields.description: Removes an existing symptom.

fields.name: linkSymptomToModel
fields.description: Links an existing model number to an existing symptom.

fields.name: attachImagesToSymptom
fields.description: Attaches / removes a images to a product symptom.

fields.name: createUser
fields.description: Creates a new authenticatable user.

fields.name: updateUser
fields.description: Updates an existing user.

fields.name: destroyUser
fields.description: Removes an existing user.

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Resets the password for the current user dependent on a temporary access token.

fields.name: createUploads
fields.description: Returns a set of upload endpoints from AWS S3.

fields.name: createRGA
fields.description: Creates a new RGA.

fields.name: updateRGA
fields.description: Updates an existing RGA.

fields.name: updateRGAStatus
fields.description: Updates the status of a specific RGA.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the RGA to update.

args.name: notes
args.description: Any additional notes about the update.

fields.name: submitRGAForReview
fields.description: Allows an end user to submit an RGA Good for review by the RPMed Internal Team.

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the RGA to process.

args.name: notes
args.description: Any additional notes about the RGA.

fields.name: updateRGAShippingStatus
fields.description: Updates the shipping status of a specific RGA.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the RGA to update.

args.name: notes
args.description: Any additional notes about the update.

args.name: shippingUpdates
args.description: The specific shipping updates for each good belonging to the RGA.

fields.name: createRGAGood
fields.description: Creates a new good for an existing RGA.

fields.name: updateRGAGood
fields.description: Updates an existing good for an existing RGA.

fields.name: destroyRGAGood
fields.description: Removes an existing RGA good.

inputFields.name: warrantyTerm

inputFields.name: warrantyDescription

inputFields.name: feeWithWarranty

inputFields.name: feeWithoutWarranty

inputFields.name: resolutionWithWarranty
inputFields.description: How issues will be resolved if this item is covered by a warranty.

inputFields.name: resolutionWithoutWarranty
inputFields.description: How issues will be resolved if this item is not covered by a warranty.

inputFields.name: publicNotes

inputFields.name: privateNotes
inputFields.description: Any internal notes for employess when servicing this model variation.

inputFields.name: publiclyViewable
inputFields.description: If a product model is not publicly viewable it will not show up on forms for a customer.

inputFields.description: The message to email to all specified recipients

inputFields.name: carrier

types.name: RGAShippingStatus
types.description: Indicates the shipping status for a given good that belongs to an RGA.

enumValues.name: DELAYED
enumValues.description: Indicates that a given item could not be shipped for various reasons.

enumValues.name: SHIPPED
enumValues.description: Indicates an RGA good has shipped.

types.name: RGAGoodInput
types.description: The input to make changes to an existing RGA Good.

inputFields.name: modelNumber
inputFields.description: The model number for representing the specific product configuration for this good.

inputFields.name: lotted
inputFields.description: Indicates whether or not the model was considered to be lotted.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: The current status of the good.

inputFields.name: warrantied
inputFields.description: Indicates whether or not this product is currently under warranty.

inputFields.name: warrantyDescription
inputFields.description: Indicates the details of the associated products warranty.

inputFields.name: warrantyTerm
inputFields.description: Indicates the number of months the associated product was warrantied for.

inputFields.name: symptomId
inputFields.description: The symptom / reason this product is being returned.

inputFields.name: symptomDescription
inputFields.description: The current description of the symptom.

inputFields.name: preApproved
inputFields.description: Indicates whether or not the resolution for the symptom was a pre-approved repair.

inputFields.name: faultCode
inputFields.description: The fault code associated to the prescribed symptom.

inputFields.name: serial
inputFields.description: The serial number unique to this good if lotted. If left blank and not lotted a uuid will be generated.

inputFields.name: productType
inputFields.description: Indicates the product type for this good.

inputFields.name: productName
inputFields.description: Indicates the name of product family this good.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: Indicates the product family this good.

inputFields.name: resolution
inputFields.description: The proposed resolution the issue affecting this good.

inputFields.name: resolutionFee
inputFields.description: The fee involved for resolving this issue.

inputFields.name: symptomSynopsis
inputFields.description: The synopsis of the associated symptom.

inputFields.name: symptomSolution
inputFields.description: The solution for associated symptom.

inputFields.name: rma
inputFields.description: The associated RMA from our distributor / partner's records.

inputFields.name: po
inputFields.description: The associated PO from our distributor / partner's records.

inputFields.name: notes
inputFields.description: Any additional notes about this good specifically..

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: The id of the customer if the product has been registered to a user.

inputFields.name: customerName
inputFields.description: The name of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

inputFields.name: customerEmail
inputFields.description: The email of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

inputFields.name: customerPhone
inputFields.description: The phone number of the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerStreet
inputFields.description: The street address for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerStreet2
inputFields.description: The street address (line 2) for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerCity
inputFields.description: The city of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerState
inputFields.description: The state of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerZip
inputFields.description: The zip of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerCountry
inputFields.description: The country of the address for the customer this good belongs to.

inputFields.name: customerSpecialty
inputFields.description: The specialty of the customer this good belongs to - it will be automatically registered if it hasn't already been.

inputFields.name: shippingSpeed
inputFields.description: The preferred shipping speed assigned to return this good to the customer.

inputFields.name: datePurchased
inputFields.description: The original date of purchase if known.

inputFields.name: disposition
inputFields.description: The disposition of the good after evaluation.

inputFields.name: ssd
inputFields.description: Indicates whether or not an SSD is applicable to this good.

inputFields.name: additionalComments
inputFields.description: Any additional comments for the service letter.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: ConnectionPayload
types.description:
Used as an argument on any query incorporating the relay connection spec
to orchestrate paginated results

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description: The id of the item to fetch forward pagination. Use with first.

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description: The id of the item to fetch backward pagination. Use with last.

inputFields.name: first
inputFields.description: A limit when performing forward pagination.

inputFields.name: last
inputFields.description: A limit when performing backward pagination.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Provides essential pagination info for a connection (or paginated request)

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Indicates whether or not there is a next page after this connection result.

fields.name: hasNextPages
fields.description: Returns any available pages after to the current set based on the limit.

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Indicates whether or not there is a previous page before this connection result.

fields.name: hasPreviousPages
fields.description: Returns any available pages prior to the current set based on the limit.

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: The cursor representing the id of the first item in the connection result.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: The cursor representing the id of the last item in the connection result.

types.name: PaginationEntry
types.description: A description of a pagination destination to fetch additional paginated results.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The id of the entry to use for the pagination request.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
